gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Transparency
Class AxisOverlay2D

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Transparency.OverlayJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Transparency.AxisOverlay2D
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IOverlay, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class AxisOverlay2D
extends OverlayJPanel

This class is used by view components to calibrate a JPanel. Besides calibration, axis labels and graph title are set here. To add grid lines, make a call to editGridLines() to view the AxisEditor.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

NO_AXES

public static final int NO_AXES
0 - This constant primative integer causes neither the x nor y axes to be displayed by the AxisOverlay2D class.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

X_AXIS

public static final int X_AXIS
1 - This constant primative integer causes the x axis to be displayed by the AxisOverlay2D class.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Y_AXIS

public static final int Y_AXIS
2 - This constant primative integer causes the y axis to be displayed by the AxisOverlay2D class.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DUAL_AXES

public static final int DUAL_AXES
3 - This constant primative integer causes both the x and y axes to be displayed by the AxisOverlay2D class.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

PRECISION

public static final java.lang.String PRECISION
"Precision" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the precision of values for this axis overlay. The value that this key references is a primative integer.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FONT

public static final java.lang.String FONT
"Font" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the font of the calibrations for this axis overlay. The value that this key references is of type Font.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

AXES_DISPLAYED

public static final java.lang.String AXES_DISPLAYED
"Axes Displayed" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about which axes are to be displayed by the axis overlay. The value that this key references is a primative integer. The integer values are specified by public variables NO_AXES, X_AXIS, Y_AXIS, and DUAL_AXES.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

X_SCALE

public static final java.lang.String X_SCALE
"X Scale" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the x axis and whether it is log or linear. The value that this key references is an Integer. The values are specified by public variables LINEAR, TRU_LOG, or PSEUDO_LOG, all found in the AxisInfo class.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Y_SCALE

public static final java.lang.String Y_SCALE
"Y Scale" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the y axis and whether it is log or linear. The value that this key references is an Integer. The values are specified by public variables LINEAR, TRU_LOG, or PSEUDO_LOG, all found in the AxisInfo class.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

TWO_SIDED

public static final java.lang.String TWO_SIDED
"Two Sided" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the one- or two-sided data calibrated by the overlay. The value that this key references is a primative boolean. The boolean values are either true for two-sided or false for one-sided.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GRID_DISPLAY_X

public static final java.lang.String GRID_DISPLAY_X
"Grid Display X" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the x axis gridlines displayed by the overlay. The value that this key references is a primative integer. The integer values are either 0 = none, 1 = major, or 2 = major/minor.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GRID_DISPLAY_Y

public static final java.lang.String GRID_DISPLAY_Y
"Grid Display Y" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the y axis gridlines displayed by the overlay. The value that this key references is a primative integer. The integer values are either 0 = none, 1 = major, or 2 = major/minor.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GRID_COLOR

public static final java.lang.String GRID_COLOR
"Grid Color" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the color of gridlines displayed by the overlay. The value that this key references is of type Color. The Color values come from Sun's Java package.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

EDITOR_BOUNDS

public static final java.lang.String EDITOR_BOUNDS
"Editor Bounds" - This constant String is a key for referencing the state information about the size and bounds of the Axis Editor window. The value that this key references is a Rectangle. The Rectangle contains the dimensions for the editor.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

AxisOverlay2D

public AxisOverlay2D(IAxisAddible iaa)
Constructor for initializing a new AxisOverlay2D, with tick marks pointing outward by default.

Parameters:
iaa - The IAxisAddible object to which the axis overlay is added.

AxisOverlay2D

public AxisOverlay2D(IAxisAddible iaa,
                     boolean inward)
Constructor for initializing a new AxisOverlay2D, with tick mark direction specified by the "inward" flag.

Parameters:
iaa - The IAxisAddible object to which the axis overlay is added.
inward - Boolean flag indicating whether or not the tick marks should be pointing inward. If true, the tick marks point in toward the center of the graph region; if false, they point away from the graph region.

AxisOverlay2D

public AxisOverlay2D(IAxisAddible iaa,
                     ObjectState state)
Constructor for creating a new AxisOverlay2D with previous state settings.

Parameters:
iaa - - IAxisAddible2D object
state - - previously saved state

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
This method will get the current values of the state variables for this object. These variables will be wrapped in an ObjectState.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Specified by:
getObjectState in class OverlayJPanel
Parameters:
isDefault - Should selective state be returned, that used to store user preferences common from project to project?
Returns:
if true, the default state containing user preferences, if false, the entire state, suitable for project specific saves.

setPrecision

public void setPrecision(int digits)
Sets the significant digits to be displayed.

Parameters:

setDisplayAxes

public void setDisplayAxes(int display_scheme)
Specify which axes should be drawn. Options are NO_AXES, X_AXIS, Y_AXIS, or DUAL_AXES.

Parameters:
display_scheme -

setTwoSided

public void setTwoSided(boolean doublesided)
Specify whether the data is one-sided or two-sided. This will affect how logarithmic calibrations are done.

Parameters:
doublesided - - true if two-sided

setXScale

public void setXScale(int xscale)
Specify x axis as linear or logarithmic. Options are LINEAR, TRU_LOG, or PSEUDO_LOG. Use the AxisInfo public variables to define the scale.

Parameters:
xscale -
See Also:
AxisInfo

setYScale

public void setYScale(int yscale)
Specify y axis as linear or logarithmic. Options are LINEAR, TRU_LOG, or PSEUDO_LOG. Use the AxisInfo public variables to define the scale.

Parameters:
yscale -
See Also:
AxisInfo

editGridLines

public void editGridLines()
This method displays the AxisEditor.

setGridColor

public void setGridColor(java.awt.Color color)
This method sets the color for the grid lines. Initially set to black.

Parameters:
color -

kill

public void kill()
This method is called by to inform the overlay that it is no longer needed. In turn, the overlay closes all windows created by it before closing.

Specified by:
kill in class OverlayJPanel

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
This method creates tick marks and numbers for this transparency. These graphics will overlay onto a jpanel.

Overrides:
paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
Parameters:
g - - graphics object
